numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a pattern in every category.
2. In every category, a lower percentage of young men reach out to their parents often than young women.
3. A higher percentage of young women call or video-chat their parents often than young men.
4. A lower percentage of young men call or video-chat their parents often than young women.
5. The percentage of young women who call or video-chat their parents often is higher than the percentage of young men who only text their parents often.
6. I wonder how gender relates to these percentages.
7. I ask why young men talk to their parents less often than young women.
8. One possible reason is that young men have weaker relationships with their parents than young women.
9. Another possible reason is that hormones influence this behavior.
10. This topic relates to my community.
12. Many teens become young adults around this time.
13. This change causes some children to grow away from their parents.
14. This graph is representative of me and my peers.
15. The headline is: Are you contacting your parents enough?
